      • getOutlineStyleId

        public def getOutlineStyleId() : String 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Replies the style identifier that should be used for rendering the outline.

        If an identifier exists, the outline will be enclosing by an HTML div tag with the class and id attributes set to the value.

        Returns:
        the outline style identifier.

      • setOutlineEntryFormat

        public def setOutlineEntryFormat(formatWithoutNumbers : String,
                                 formatWithNumbers : String) : void 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Change the formats to be applied to the outline entries.

        The format must be compatible with MessageFormat.

        If section auto-numbering is on, the first parameter {0} equals to the prefix, the second parameter {1} equals to the string representation of the section number, the third parameter {2} equals to the title text, and the fourth parameter {3} is the reference id of the section.

        If section auto-numbering is off, the first parameter {0} equals to the prefix, the second parameter {1} equals to the title text, and the third parameter {2} is the reference id of the section.

        Parameters:
        formatWithoutNumbers - the format for the outline entries without section numbers.
        formatWithNumbers - the format for the outline entries with section numbers.

      • getOutlineEntryFormat

        public def getOutlineEntryFormat() : String 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Replies the format to be applied to the outline entries.

        The format must be compatible with MessageFormat.

        If section auto-numbering is on, the first parameter {0} equals to the prefix, the second parameter {1} equals to the string representation of the section number, the third parameter {2} equals to the title text, and the fourth parameter {3} is the reference id of the section.

        If section auto-numbering is off, the first parameter {0} equals to the prefix, the second parameter {1} equals to the title text, and the third parameter {2} is the reference id of the section.

        Returns:
        the format.

      • setSectionTitleFormat

        public def setSectionTitleFormat(format : String) : void 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Change the format to be applied to the section titles.

        The format must be compatible with MessageFormat, with the first parameter {0} equals to the Markdown prefix, the second parameter {1} equals to the string representation of the section number, the third parameter {2} equals to the title text, and the fourth parameter {3} is the identifier of the section.

        Parameters:
        format - the format.

      • getSectionTitleFormat

        public def getSectionTitleFormat() : String 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Replies the format to be applied to the section titles.

        Returns:
        the format.

      • setSectionNumberFormat

        public def setSectionNumberFormat(format : String) : void 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Change the format to be applied to the section numbers.

        The format must be compatible with MessageFormat, with the first parameter {0} equals to the first part of the full section number, and the second parameter {1} equals to a single section number.

        Parameters:
        format - the format.

      • setKramdownFix

        public def setKramdownFix(enable : boolean) : void 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Change the flag that indicates if the bug fixes related to Kramdown are enabled. For example, the automatic section numbering is not working as expected into Kramdown; so that is should be fixed into our code.
        Parameters:

        Since:
        0.12

      • transformURL

        protected def transformURL(link : URL,
                           line : int,
                           references : AbstractMarkerLanguageParser.ReferenceContext) : URL 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Transform an URL from Markdown format to HTML format.

        Usually, the file extension ".md" is replaced by ".html".

        This function replaces the anchor to the local reference with the correct one (modified by outline feature).

        Parameters:
        link - the link to transform.
        line - the number of the line at which the link is located. If negative value, the line number is unknown.
        references - the set of references from the local document.
        Returns:
        the result of the transformation. null if the link should not changed.
        Since:
        0.12

      • transformURLAnchor

        protected def transformURLAnchor(file : File,
                                 line : int,
                                 anchor : String,
                                 references : AbstractMarkerLanguageParser.ReferenceContext) : String 
        Description copied from class: MarkdownParser
        Transform the anchor of an URL from Markdown format to HTML format.
        Parameters:
        file - the linked file.
        line - the number of the line at which the anchor is located. If negative value, the line number is unknown.
        anchor - the anchor to transform.
        references - the set of references from the local document, or null.
        Returns:
        the result of the transformation.
        Since:
        0.12
